channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bags and boxes dumped on corner of Charleston and Brandon, 19th December
item.description:
This has been here for over a week. I am not sure how it got here, but it appears to be growing in size. Please could you come and remove this to prevent this from becoming a hazard to neighbouring properties? Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charleston Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fencing around the moat is unsafe, 19th December
item.description:
Many of the posts that hold the rails around the park are rotten and the fence is rocking anfmd leaning towards the moat which is dangeous and could cause someone to fall in.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Steps and pathway covered in wet slippery leaves, 19th December
item.description:
The steps are covered in soggy slippery leaves making it dangerous to walk down and the pathway is no better. I nearly slipped down them due to the amount on the steps.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Steyning Grove, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In the garden of 49 Bartholomew road, 19th December
item.description:
The large trees are housing rodents and waste from the campus behind the garden, causing pests to come into my home. I am disabled and already dealing with severe damp causing ill health and now, due to the heavy foliage, I have rats and mice entering my property making it unsafe to live here. Please can I get some help?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bartholomew Road, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal dump, 19th December
item.description:
Hi, This huge pile of dump in front of the Renoir Court block of flats is here for 2 months now and it just grows. One of my neighbours was renewing the flat in the lower ground floor flat and they decided to just throw everything out thru the window and just left it there. This pile gets bigger and bigger and no one really cares. Foxes and rats are already visiting! Please help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stubbs Drive, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, flytipping and littering at the junction of Siward Road and Wendover Road, 19th December
item.description:
The pedestrian pavement adjacent to free parking zone at the junction of Siward Road and Wendover Road is poorly lit. The street light on the opposite side of the Road does not serve the purpose as light is blocked by parked cars and vans. Hence, there has been a constant problem of flytipping and littering on this pavement for years. In addition there has been an abandoned car for over at least 3 weeks on the yellow line. I have attached some photos. We at 34 Wendover Road have been picking up the litter including dog faeces regularly from this pavement and adjacent Road. We would really appreciate if this pavement can have a street light preferbly with surviellence cameras.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Siward Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
